'The Suppression of Religious Houses Act 1535' (27 Hen 8 c 28), also referred to
as the 'Act for the Dissolution of the Lesser Monasteries', William John
Hardy. Documents Illustrative of English Church History. Macmillan and Co Ltd.
1914. Page 257. was an Act of the Parliament of England.

It was passed by the English Reformation Parliament of 1535/36. It was the
beginning of the legal process by which King Henry VIII set about the
Dissolution of the Monasteries. It was enacted in February 1535.

Sections 4 to 6 and 8 to 12 and 14 were repealed by section 1 of, and Schedule 1
to, the Statute Law Revision Act 1948.

The whole Act, so far as unrepealed, was repealed by section 1 of, and Part II
of the Schedule to, the Statute Law (Repeals) Act 1969.
